Contractor's Acknowledgment and use of Certified Payments
The Contractor hereby irrevocably acknowledges and agrees that all certified payments disbursed by the Employer, including, but not limited to, the Advance Payment, shall be used exclusively for financing the costs directly associated with the execution and completion of the Works under this Construction Contract, until their successful completion and taking over by the Employer. text:

heading: 30.6(A)
text:
Where Clause 30.4(A) applies, the Employer shall not after entry upon any part of the Site and execution of any parts, activities or Sections of the Works by itself or by any other contractor or contractors employed by the Employer be liable to make any payment whatsoever to the Contractor, whether in connection with the Contract or the Works or for any other reason of any kind until the issuance of the Taking-Over Certificate for the whole of the Works, and thereafter until the Cost of completing works so taken by the Employer to be completed or executed by itself or by any other contractor or contractors and all other Costs incurred by the Employer in relation thereto have been ascertained and the amount thereof has been certified by the Contract Administrator. The Employer may (without prejudice to its right to recover from the Contractor damages arising out of the Contractor's default) thereafter pay to the Contractor only as amount certified by the Contract Administrator and calculated as being:
a. the amount shown by the Interim Certificate prepared after the issuance of the Taking-Over Certificate for the whole of the Works in accordance with Clause 30.5(A); less
b. the total of all payments already made to the Contractor pursuant to Interim Certificates or otherwise and to any Nominated Subcontractor under Clause 24.2 (Delayed Payments to Nominated Subcontractors); less
c. any amount by which the Costs of completing or executing parts, activities or Sections of the Works by the Employer or any other contractor or contractors employed by the Employer and other Costs incurred by the Employer in relation thereto exceed the difference between the amount which would have been payable to the Contractor upon due completion of the Works by it and the amounts shown in the last Interim Certificate issued to the Contractor in respect of such parts, activities or Sections of the Works so taken; and less
d. any amount which is or becomes payable under Clause 19.3 (Liquidated Damages).
If the foregoing calculation should produce a negative result then the Contractor shall upon demand pay a sum equal to that result to the Employer and such sum shall be deemed a debt due from the Contractor to the Employer and be recoverable accordingly from any amounts due or to become due to the Contractor or from the Bonds submitted by the Contractor.

heading: Dispute Resolution
text: A Dispute shall be deemed to have arisen when a party notifies the other party in writing to that effect. The parties to any Dispute shall use reasonable endeavours to resolve the Dispute amicably within a period of thirty (30) days of the said written notice. Failing amicable resolution within thirty (30) days, or if the parties do not meet or commence negotiations within ten (10) days of the said written notice, then any Dispute arising out of or in connection with this Contract shall be referred to and finally resolved by the competent courts that shall have the exclusive jurisdiction to decide such dispute. During the existence of any Dispute, the Parties must continue to perform all of their obligations under this Contract without prejudice to their position in respect of such Dispute, unless the Parties otherwise agree. The Employer shall have the right to seek the necessary injunctive relief from the court of competent jurisdiction at any time to protect its legitimate interests and rights.
